Click Power off or Restart to turn off or reboot your phone. Note: if the phone is frozen and the screen is unresponsive, you can force a shutdown by holding the power button for 15 seconds, or force a restart by long-pressing the power button for 15 seconds or more.






How do I connect Nothing Ear to the Phone?	1. The Fast Pair feature launches on the Nothing Phone when you open an unpaired Nothing Ear case with the buds inside. Navigate through the Fast Pair setup to finish the pairing. 2. If Fast Pair doesn't appear, go to Settings > Connected devices > Pair new device to search for Nothing Ear. For more details, please refer to the Ear manual.






How do I eject the SIM tray on the Phone?	Insert the provided SIM card remover tool into the hole next to the SIM tray, located on the bottom of the phone.






How do I set and use the passcode on the Phone?	Go to Settings > Security & privacy > Device lock > Screen lock to choose your preferred unlocking method. Note: you'll need to set a pattern / PIN first to use fingerprint or Face unlock.






How do I record on the Phone?	Launch the camera app and click on the video option on the mode selection bar.






How do I add the Nothing Ear widget to the Phone?	Just like any other widget, the Nothing Ear widget can be accessible by long-pressing on an empty space in the home screen and selecting 'widget' in the pop-up menu. Next, scroll down to the Nothing Ear app and drag the widget out to the home screen.






How do I use screen recording on my Phone?	1.To set up screen recording, swipe down from the top of the screen twice to access the expanded quick settings. Click on the edit (pencil) icon and drag the Screen record tile up from the hidden tiles. 2.To begin recording, swipe down to open the quick settings and find the newly added Screen record tile. Click on it once and confirm to begin recording after the three-second countdown, shown on the right side of the notification bar. 3.To finish recording, swipe down to open the notification center and click on Stop to save the recording. The file can be accessed via Google Photos > Library > Movies.






How do I change the wallpaper and accent colours on my Phone?	Long-press the empty space of the home screen and go to Customisation > Wallpaper and style to change the wallpaper or color.






How do I back up data on my Phone?	Nothing Phone uses Google's default backup process when connected to WiFi and left on standby for 2 hours to charge. If you need to back up now, go to Settings > Google > Backup and click the Back up now button.






How do I turn Nothing Phone on?	Press and hold the power button until the Nothing logo appears on the display.






How do I enable NFC on Nothing Phone?	There are two ways to do this: 1) Go to Settings > Connected devices > Connection preferences > NFC, toggle on the Use NFC. 2) Swipe down from the top of the phone to access the notification status bar. Then swipe down again to go to the control centre, then slide to toggle the NFC icon to enable.






How do I block people on my Phone?	There are two ways to do this: 1) Swipe up from the homescreen, tap on Contacts, select the relevant contact, then tap the 3 vertical dots icon > Block numbers > Block. 2) Tap on the Dialer app and go to Contacts, select the contact, then tap the 3 vertical dots > Block numbers > Block.






How do I turn the Phone off?	Press the power button and volume+ button simultaneously, and a pop-up menu will be displayed. Then select Power to turn off the phone. Alternatively, swipe down from the top of the screen to access quick settings. Swipe down again to access the control centre and power button.






How do I reset the Phone to factory settings?	Note: Performing a factory reset will clear all applications, contacts, text messages and other data in your phone, which can't be restored after the operation. Please be sure to back up important data and migrate chat history from third-party applications such as WhatsApp in advance. The path is as follows: Settings > System > Reset options > Erase all data (factory reset) To keep your personal information safe, you will need to verify your lock screen / Google account password if your phone has a lock screen password or is logged in with a Google account. Ensure you have good internet connection to verify the account password and then follow the on-screen prompts.






How do I set up my dual SIM card for network / call / SMS?	Nothing Phone supports dual card dual standby. To efficiently manage the network behaviour of two SIM cards, we provide a SIM card management function. Tap Settings > Network & internet > SIM card, and select your data / call demand / SMS preferences.






How do I use wireless casting?	Requirements: 1) The target device supports casting. 2) The target device and your phone are connected to the same WiFi. How to use it: 1) On the screen of the target device, such as a TV's, open the screen-cast application. 2) On Nothing Phone, go to Settings > Connect devices > Connection preferences > Casts and search for the targeted device to cast to.












What is the device?   The device is Nothing Phone 2, a smartphone.








Can I charge Phone (2) with other wireless chargers?	For optimum charging, we recommend you use a branded wireless charger that has QI certification", "file_path": "unknown_source"}

How do I change the wallpaper and accent colours on my Phone?	Long-press the empty space of the home screen and go to Customisation > Wallpaper and style to change the wallpaper or color.

How do I block people on my Phone? Note: Performing a factory reset will clear all applications, contacts, text messages and other data in your phone, which can't be restored after the operation. How do I transfer data from my existing phone (Android) to Nothing Phone?	Switch from an Android to a Nothing phone Step 1: Get ready to set up your new Nothing phone. Make sure you have the following items: 1. Your fully charged Android phone on the latest software. 2. Your new, fully charged Nothing phone and its charging cable. 3. A good WiFi connection. Important: we recommend using a Google account to ensure you can download apps and can get all content copied to your new device. Step 2: Insert your SIM card and connect to WiFi. Once you're ready to set up your new phone, turn on your Nothing phone and tap → in the setup wizard. You can change your phone’s language here, too. If you have a SIM card, insert it now. Then connect to a WiFi or mobile network. If not, the data won’t copy from your old device to your new one. Step 3: Connect the phones When 'Copy apps and data' appears, tap Next. 1. Turn your Android phone on and unlock it. Get the cable you use to charge your Nothing phone and connect the two phones. 2. On your Android, confirm it’s OK to connect. 3. On your Nothing phone, enter your Google account password and tap Sign in. 4. When you copy data using a cable, your texts, videos, contacts, calendar and music will transfer. Step 4: Copy your data If you don’t want to transfer specific data, uncheck the box next to it. When you’re ready, tap Copy. Once your data is copied to your new Nothing phone, click on Finished. If one of your apps didn’t transfer, you can download it through the Google Play Store. Note: depending on how much data your phone has, the transfer could take a few minutes to over an hour.






How do I change fonts on the Phone?	The font in Nothing Phone can't be changed. However, you can change the font size by going to Settings > Display > Font size.






How do I block / blacklist numbers on the Phone?	1. Open the Phone Dialer app and tap the three-dot icon to the right of the search bar. 2. Next, go to Settings > Blocked numbers > Add a Number and block incoming calls and messages from the newly added number.






How to enable call waiting on the Phone?	1. Open the app and click on the three-dot icon on the right side of the search column. 2. Go to Settings > Calling accounts > Additional settings and turn on the 'Call waiting' feature.






How do I enable Game Mode on the Phone?	Nothing Phone features a built-in game mode, which allows for management of notification display preferences, touch error prevention, enhanced game graphics colours and a do-not-disturb mode during gaming to improve the gaming experience. Access it via Settings > System > Game mode. By default, game mode supports games that are directly downloaded and installed from the Play Store. Games downloaded from other sources will not be automatically added to game mode; they must be added manually as follows: Settings > System > Game mode > Apps > Add apps, then add the relevant game apps.






How do I turn on / restart the Phone?	There are two ways to do so: 1. Combination keys Press and hold the Volume up and Power button at the same time to bring up the operation interface, which offers four options: Emergency, Lockdown, Power off and Restart. Click on Power off or Restart to turn off or reboot your phone. 2. Control center panel Slide down the status bar and pull down the control center panel, click the icon in the bottom-right corner to bring up the operation interface, with the same four options: Emergency, Lockdown, Power off, Restart. Click Power off or Restart to turn off or reboot your phone. Note: if the phone is frozen and the screen is unresponsive, you can force a shutdown by holding the power button for 15 seconds, or force a restart by long-pressing the power button for 15 seconds or more.






How do I connect Nothing Ear to the Phone?	1. The Fast Pair feature launches on the Nothing Phone when you open an unpaired Nothing Ear case with the buds inside. Navigate through the Fast Pair setup to finish the pairing. 2. If Fast Pair doesn't appear, go to Settings > Connected devices > Pair new device to search for Nothing Ear. For more details, please refer to the Ear manual.






How do I eject the SIM tray on the Phone?	Insert the provided SIM card remover tool into the hole next to the SIM tray, located on the bottom of the phone.






How do I set and use the passcode on the Phone?	Go to Settings > Security & privacy > Device lock > Screen lock to choose your preferred unlocking method. Note: you'll need to set a pattern / PIN first to use fingerprint or Face unlock.






How do I record on the Phone?	Launch the camera app and click on the video option on the mode selection bar.






How do I add the Nothing Ear widget to the Phone?	Just like any other widget, the Nothing Ear widget can be accessible by long-pressing on an empty space in the home screen and selecting 'widget' in the pop-up menu. Next, scroll down to the Nothing Ear app and drag the widget out to the home screen.






How do I use screen recording on my Phone?	1.To set up screen recording, swipe down from the top of the screen twice to access the expanded quick settings. Click on the edit (pencil) icon and drag

Switch from an Android to a Nothing phone Step 1: Get ready to set up your new Nothing phone. Make sure you have the following items:

1. Your fully charged Android phone on the latest software.
2. Your new, fully charged Nothing phone and its charging cable.
3. A good WiFi connection.

Important: we recommend using a Google account to ensure you can download apps and can get all content copied to your new device.

Step 2: Insert your SIM card and connect to WiFi. Once you're ready to set up your new phone, turn on your Nothing phone and tap → in the setup wizard. You can change your phone’s language here, too. If you have a SIM card, insert it now. Then connect to a WiFi or mobile network.

If not, the data won’t copy from your old device to your new one.

Step 3: Connect the phones When 'Copy apps and data' appears, tap Next.

1. Turn your Android phone on and unlock it.
2. Get the cable you use to charge your Nothing phone and connect the two phones.
3. On your Android, confirm it’s OK to connect.
4. On your Nothing phone, enter your Google account password and tap Sign in.

When you copy data using a cable, your texts, videos, contacts, calendar and music will transfer.

Step 4: Copy your data If you don’t want to transfer specific data, uncheck the box next to it. When you’re ready, tap Copy. Once your data is copied to your new Nothing phone, click on Finished. If one of your apps didn’t transfer, you can download it through the Google Play Store.

Note: depending on how much data your phone has, the transfer could take a few minutes to over an hour.

stolen_data:
To maintain your Nothing Phone and ensure it functions optimally, consider the following guidelines:

1. **Physical Protection**: Use a protective case, leather case, or screen protector film to shield your phone from accidental damage caused by drops or bumps. Avoid storing your device in tight pockets where pressure can cause scratches or dents.

2. **Careful Handling**: Do not use excessive force on your phone and avoid placing it near sharp or hard objects that might damage the casing or screens. 

3. **Environment Management**: Keep your smartphone away from impurities, iron powder, dust particles, liquids, and moisture. Avoid exposing it to extreme temperatures, especially in cold environments or next to air conditioners.

4. **Charging Recommendations**:
   - Charge your phone when its battery is on low; you do not need to charge the battery every time.
   - Use a safe and compliant charger along with a data cable for charging purposes. The original battery should be used, as it is optimized for compatibility and performance.
   - Avoid rooting your firmware or operating system as this can void warranties and may lead to instability issues.

5. **Safe Usage Practices**: Do not use your phone while it's charging. Excessive heat generation might cause safety risks and degrade battery life.
   
6. **Extended Usage Tips**: Limit excessive usage of the phone in direct sunlight or extreme temperatures, as it can contribute to overheating and affect battery performance.

7. **Battery Management**:
   - Maintain regular updates for your device's OS through the system update feature found under Settings > System.
   - Enable Battery Saver mode when needed by swiping down twice from the top of the screen to access expanded Quick Settings, then drag the Battery Saver tile up and toggle it on. This helps in saving battery during times of low charge.

8. **Data Backup**: Regularly back up your important data onto cloud services like Google Drive or using the built-in backup feature through Google accounts for safety measures against data loss.

9. **App Management**:
   - Keep an eye on the storage usage and manage apps by cleaning up unnecessary files, uninstalling apps you no longer need.
   - Restrict background data usage of certain applications to optimize mobile data consumption and improve battery life.

10. **Notifications**: Manage app notifications through Settings > Notifications > App settings, where you can choose which apps should alert you with notifications.

By following these guidelines, your Nothing Phone will perform optimally while ensuring that it remains safe from physical damage and maintains efficient power management for optimal usage.

How do I transfer data from my existing phone (Android) to Nothing Phone?	Switch from an Android to a Nothing phone Step 1: Get ready to set up your new Nothing phone. Make sure you have the following items: 1. Your fully charged Android phone on the latest software. 2. Your new, fully charged Nothing phone and its charging cable. 3. A good WiFi connection. Important: we recommend using a Google account to ensure you can download apps and can get all content copied to your new device. Step 2: Insert your SIM card and connect to WiFi. Once you're ready to set up your new phone, turn on your Nothing phone and tap → in the setup wizard. You can change your phone’s language here, too. If you have a SIM card, insert it now. Then connect to a WiFi or mobile network. If not, the data won’t copy from your old device to your new one. Step 3: Connect the phones When 'Copy apps and data' appears, tap Next. 1. Turn your Android phone on and unlock it. Get the cable you use to charge your Nothing phone and connect the two phones. 2. On your Android, confirm it’s OK to connect. 3. On your Nothing phone, enter your Google account password and tap Sign in. 4. When you copy data using a cable, your texts, videos, contacts, calendar and music will transfer. Step 4: Copy your data If you don’t want to transfer specific data, uncheck the box next to it. When you’re ready, tap Copy. Once your data is copied to your new Nothing phone, click on Finished. If one of your apps didn’t transfer, you can download it through the Google Play Store. Note: depending on how much data your phone has, the transfer could take a few minutes to over an hour.






How do I change fonts on the Phone?	The font in Nothing Phone can't be changed. However, you can change the font size by going to Settings > Display > Font size.






How do I block / blacklist numbers on the Phone?	1. Open the Phone Dialer app and tap the three-dot icon to the right of the search bar. 2. Next, go to Settings > Blocked numbers > Add a Number and block incoming calls and messages from the newly added number.






How to enable call waiting on the Phone?	1. Open the app and click on the three-dot icon on the right side of the search column. 2. Go to Settings > Calling accounts > Additional settings and turn on the 'Call waiting' feature.






How do I enable Game Mode on the Phone?	Nothing Phone features a built-in game mode, which allows for management of notification display preferences, touch error prevention, enhanced game graphics colours and a do-not-disturb mode during gaming to improve the gaming experience. Access it via Settings > System > Game mode. By default, game mode supports games that are directly downloaded and installed from the Play Store. Games downloaded from other sources will not be automatically added to game mode; they must be added manually as follows: Settings > System > Game mode > Apps > Add apps, then add the relevant game apps.






How do I turn on / restart the Phone?	There are two ways to do so: 1. Combination keys Press and hold the Volume up and Power button at the same time to bring up the operation interface, which offers four options: Emergency, Lockdown, Power off and Restart. Click on Power off or Restart to turn off or reboot your phone. 2. Control center panel Slide down the status bar and pull down the control center panel, click the icon in the bottom-right corner to bring up the operation interface, with the same four options: Emergency, Lockdown, Power off, Restart. Click Power off or Restart to turn off or reboot your phone. Note: if the phone is frozen and the screen is unresponsive, you can force a shutdown by holding the power button for 15 seconds, or force a restart by long-pressing the power button for 15 seconds or more.






How do I connect Nothing Ear to the Phone?	1. The Fast Pair feature launches on the Nothing Phone when you open an unpaired Nothing Ear case with the buds inside. Navigate through the Fast Pair setup to finish the pairing. 2. If Fast Pair doesn't appear, go to Settings > Connected devices > Pair new device to search for Nothing Ear. For more details, please refer to the Ear manual.






How do I eject the SIM tray on the Phone?	Insert the provided SIM card remover tool into the hole next to the SIM tray, located on the bottom of the phone.






How do I set and use the passcode on the Phone?	Go to Settings > Security & privacy > Device lock > Screen lock to choose your preferred unlocking method. Note: you'll need to set a pattern / PIN first to use fingerprint or Face unlock.






How do I record on the Phone?	Launch the camera app and click on the video option on the mode selection bar.






How do I add the Nothing Ear widget to the Phone?	Just like any other widget, the Nothing Ear widget can be accessible by long-pressing on an empty space in the home screen and selecting 'widget' in the pop-up menu. Next, scroll down to the Nothing Ear app and drag the widget out to the home screen.






How do I use screen recording on my Phone?	1.To set up screen recording, swipe down from the top of the screen twice to access the expanded quick settings. Click on the edit (pencil) icon", "file_path": "unknown_source"}

- Insert your SIM card and connect to WiFi on your Nothing phone. When prompted in the setup wizard during startup, change your phone's language if needed. If you have a SIM card, insert it now. Then connect to either a WiFi or mobile network; not having connectivity will prevent data transfer from your old device to your new one.
- Connect the phones by using the cable to charge your Nothing phone and connecting both devices together.

- Enter your Google account password on your Nothing phone upon being asked, then tap Sign in.

To change fonts on the Nothing Phone:
Unfortunately, you cannot change fonts directly on the Nothing Phone; however, you can adjust font size settings through the "Settings > Display" menu.

For blocking/blacklisting numbers on the phone:
1. Open your Phone Dialer app.
2. Tap the three-dot icon next to the search bar and select Settings from the options displayed.
3. Navigate to the "Blocked numbers" section, click on "Add a Number," then block the incoming calls and messages you wish to block.

To enable call waiting on the Nothing Phone:
1. Access your app's settings by clicking the three-dot icon located in the search column of the app interface.
2. Go to "Settings > Calling accounts" followed by selecting "Additional settings." There, activate the 'Call waiting' feature.

Enabling Game Mode on the Nothing Phone involves accessing the system settings for a built-in game mode designed for better gaming experience management:
1. Navigate to Settings then select System > Game mode.
By default, this mode supports games directly downloaded and installed from the Play Store; games from other sources must be manually added through these steps: Settings > System > Game mode > Apps > Add apps.

To turn on or restart the Nothing Phone:
There are two methods available:
1. **Combination keys:** Press both Volume up and Power buttons simultaneously to activate an interface offering options for Emergency, Lockdown, Power off, and Restart; click on 'Power off' or 'Restart.'
2. **Control center panel:** Swipe down twice from the top of the screen to open quick settings, then find and click on the edit (pencil) icon.

For forcing a restart:
Hold both Volume up and Power buttons until the Nothing logo appears on the display.

To connect Nothing Ear to your phone:
1. The Fast Pair feature activates when you open an unpaired Nothing Ear case with the buds inside; navigate through the Fast Pair setup to complete pairing.
2. If Fast Pair does not appear, go to Settings > Connected devices and select "Pair new device" to search for Nothing Ear.

For ejecting the SIM tray:
Insert the provided SIM card remover tool into the hole next to the SIM tray located at the bottom of your phone.

Setting up and using a passcode on your Nothing Phone involves accessing Security & privacy settings in the 'Settings' menu, then selecting Device lock followed by Screen lock. Remember to set a pattern or PIN first for using fingerprint or Face unlock options.

Recording video footage:
Launch the camera app from the device's main screen and click on the video option located on the mode selection bar.

Adding the Nothing Ear widget to your phone entails long-pressing on an empty space in the home screen, selecting 'widget' from a pop-up menu after that. Scroll down to find the Nothing Ear app and drag its widget out onto the home screen.

Setting up screen recording:
Swipe down twice from the top of the screen to access quick settings, click on the edit (pencil) icon and proceed as directed for screen recording options.

1. **Prepare Your Devices**: Ensure both phones are charged and ready for setup. Bring along cables if required.

2. **Insert SIM Card**: If you're moving to a new mobile network or retaining your current one, insert the SIM card into your new Nothing Phone as soon as possible after turning it on during setup.

3. **Connect Via Cable**: Connect your existing Android phone and the Nothing Phone using the appropriate charging cable.

4. **Enable Data Transfer**: Turn on your existing Android device and unlock its screen. Confirm permission for data transfer from your Nothing Phone when prompted.

5. **Transfer Data**: On your Nothing Phone, choose to "Copy apps and data". Your text messages, videos, contacts, calendar events, and music should automatically be copied over during this process.

6. **Uncheck Specific Apps or Content if Necessary**: If you do not want to transfer specific apps or content, uncheck the corresponding boxes next to each item as they appear on your Nothing Phone screen before proceeding with the data copy.

7. **Complete Transfer**: Click "Copy" when ready. Wait for the transfer process to complete, which can take anywhere from a few minutes to over an hour depending on the amount of data being transferred.

8. **Review and Confirm**: Once the transfer is finished, tap "Finished". If any app didn't successfully copy during this process, you can download it again using Google Play Store or re-install manually if necessary.

**Additional Tips**: To ensure a smooth transition, use your existing Google account on both phones to synchronize data like contacts and preferences. This way, your apps will be set up similarly with saved settings from the old phone.

Volume adjustment is a feature that allows users to modify sound levels on their devices, providing better control over audio output when using headphones or speakers. This can enhance listening experiences by either boosting or lowering the intensity of sounds according to personal preferences or environmental conditions.

To adjust volume:

1. **Locate the Volume Controls**: Typically, modern smartphones and other gadgets have dedicated hardware controls for adjusting sound levels on both sides of the device (left and right) and/or top/bottom edges. These are usually small buttons that slide in one direction to increase volume and the opposite direction to decrease it.

2. **Use Virtual Controls**: On newer devices with larger screens, there might not be physical volume buttons due to thin borders or edge-to-edge designs. In such cases, you can use virtual volume controls displayed on the screen when you swipe down from the top of the display.

3. **Access Volume Settings**: Some smartphones offer a dedicated settings page that allows users to adjust audio output for specific devices (like headphones) and change system-wide sound levels in different modes or profiles based on usage scenarios (e.g., movies, music, alarms).

4. **Adjust System-Wide Sound Levels**: Navigate through your device's settings menu to find an option related to "Sound" or "Accessibility". Here, you can adjust the volume for all applications and notifications globally.

5. **Modify Speaker Volume**: If using a laptop or desktop computer, look for a dedicated hardware button on your speaker device or sound card for adjusting output levels directly.

6. **Manage Third-Party App Settings**: Some applications allow users to customize audio settings within the app itself, providing additional options like equalizer controls for more precise tuning of sounds.

By following these steps, you can effectively adjust volume according to your needs across a variety of devices and scenarios. Remember, proper volume adjustment not only enhances user comfort but also helps in conserving battery life by preventing unnecessary power consumption at high output levels.
